articles.description: Follow live text and BBC Radio 5 Sports Extra commentary from first and second practice at the Bahrain Grand Prix.
articles.title: Bahrain Grand Prix first practice - radio & text

articles.description: Reaction to Wednesday night's FA Cup action as Chelsea, Manchester United and Liverpool progress, plus all the latest football news.
articles.title: FA Cup reaction including Chelsea, Manchester United and Liverpool

articles.description: Al-Nassr forward Cristiano Ronaldo is banned for one match for "provoking fans" following the Saudi Pro League win over Al-Shabab.
articles.title: Ronaldo banned for gesture after 'Messi' chants

articles.description: Teenagers Lewis Koumas and Jayden Danns are on target as Liverpool beat Southampton to set up an FA Cup quarter-final tie with Manchester United.
articles.title: Danns and Koumas take Liverpool past Southampton

articles.description: Australia all-rounder Cameron Green scores a century as he produces his side's main resistance on the opening day of the first Test in New Zealand.
articles.title: Australia's Green scores century to repel Kiwis

articles.description: Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag accuses Nottingham Forest of targeting skipper Bruno Fernandes in their FA Cup fifth-round tie and calls his social media critics "pathetic".
articles.title: Fernandes play-acting criticism 'pathetic' - Ten Hag

articles.description: Conor Gallagher scores a last-minute winner as Chelsea snatch a dramatic victory over Leeds United to move into the FA Cup quarter-finals.
articles.title: Chelsea snatch dramatic win over Leeds in FA Cup

articles.description: Britain's Katie Boulter comes from a set down to beat Brazil's Beatriz Haddad Maia in the San Diego Open second round.
articles.title: San Diego Open: Katie Boulter beats Beatriz Haddad Maia to reach quarter-finals

articles.description: Rangers battle back from a goal down to preserve their two-point Scottish Premiership lead with a dogged and important victory at Kilmarnock.
articles.title: Rangers fight back at Kilmarnock to stay top

articles.description: LeBron James scores 34 points to help the Los Angeles Lakers overcome a 21-point deficit to beat the Los Angeles Clippers 116-112.
articles.title: NBA: LeBron James stars in dramatic LA Lakers comeback win against LA Clippers
